entries.name: Recovery Saves
entries: Jede Stunde macht die Kreatur eine weitere Konstitutionspr√ºfung gegen den aktuellen DC-Wert, um eine Stufe des Rausches zu entfernen. items: Der zugef√ºgte Schaden entspricht jetzt dem Schaden an MAX HP.

disease.name: Alcohol Amblyopia
entries: Die Alkohol-Ambloyopie ist eine seltene Augenkrankheit, die in der Regel auf langfristigen Alkoholkonsum zur√ºckzuf√ºhren ist. Danach wird das Opfer blind.

Die typischen Beschwerden sind ein schmerzloses Verschwimmen des Sehverm√∂gens √ºber einen Zeitraum von mehreren Wochen (2d4) mit verminderter Sch√§rfe sowohl f√ºr nahe als auch f√ºr entfernte Objekte. Im Allgemeinen treten die Ver√§nderungen symmetrisch in beiden Augen auf und k√∂nnen, wenn sie nicht angemessen behandelt werden, zu einer Degeneration des Sehnervs f√ºhren. Die Behandlung besteht in den fr√ºhen Stadien aus Vitaminen und Mineralien oder einer gezielten Heilungsmagie, f√ºr die Erblindung ist jedoch eine gr√∂√üere Wiederherstellung erforderlich.

entries: Von einem antiken Wort kirrhos orangefarben - die Farbe einer Zirrhoseleber. Die Zirrhose ist eine chronisch entz√ºndliche Erkrankung der Leber, bei der funktionierende Leberzellen durch Narbengewebe ersetzt werden. Die Hauptursache f√ºr eine Zirrhose ist langfristiger Alkoholkonsum.

entries: {@bold Description} (dem Spieler zugewandt): Dieses Getr√§nk ist in der Schattenfell sehr beliebt. Es ist ein dunkles Bier, das nach modriger Erde riecht, aber es ist reichhaltig und einladend.

entries: {@bold Description} (dem Spieler zugewandt): Goldbraun;Die √úbersetzung des Namens dieses Getr√§nks ist ein alter, orkischer Fluch - einer, den man nicht in h√∂flicher Gesellschaft ausspricht. {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Der Trinker muss einen Rettungswurf der Konstitution DC 15 ablegen. Bei einem Erfolg ist der Trinker f√ºr eine Minute vergiftet. {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Wirf einen W√ºrfel. Bei 19-20 wird der Trinker von allen nichtmagischen Giften und Krankheiten geheilt. Eine Flasche enth√§lt 40 Getr√§nke.

{@bold Features} (GM-zugewandt): Der Trinker verstr√∂mt 1d4 Stunden lang ein sanftes Gl√ºhen wie eine Kerze.

item.name: Goat's Milk
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Wei√ü;Frische Ziegenmilch. Was will man mehr (au√üer einem richtigen Getr√§nk)? Irgendwann w√§hrend Ihrer Bestellung hat der Barkeeper Ihre Bestellung mit der eines Wanderm√∂nchs verwechselt, der strikt abstinent ist.

entries: {@bold Description} (Spieler zugewandt): Gelb; "Was? Igitt, nein, nat√ºrlich werde ich das nicht trinken...Was meinst du, ein Feigling? Gib das her und sieh zu, wie ich das ganze Ding runterschlucke!".

Wenn du bestehst, gewinnst du die Bewunderung aller Barbesucher und erh√§ltst f√ºr den Rest des Abends Vorteile bei allen Charisma-Proben an der Bar sowie ein Freigetr√§nk deiner Wahl oder eine kostenlose Runde Ale/Bier f√ºr die Bar.

item.name: Goblin Grog (pint)

{@bold Features} (GM-zugewandt): Jeder Abenteurer, der dies trinkt, wird seine HP bei einer langen Rast nicht wiedererlangen.  Er wird zu sehr damit besch√§ftigt sein, sich zu √ºbergeben und sich die ganze Nacht schrecklich zu f√ºhlen.  Die Wirkung l√§sst nach 1 Tag nach.

entries: {@bold Description} (Spieler-zugewandt): Goop hat eine hellgraue Farbe und l√§sst sich gut mit den meisten Nahrungsmitteln vermischen. Ein Krug mit Schleim kostet 40 Goldst√ºcke.

item.name: Grilled Achaierai
entries: {@bold Description} (Spielerseite): Dieses "wei√üe" Fleisch ist aufgrund des hohen Eisengehalts, den es in seiner Heimatdimension Acheron hat, selbst beim Kochen rosa-braun. Das Fleisch ist ziemlich z√§h und riecht leicht nach seinem rauchigen Atem. Es ist schwierig, Achaierai-Fleisch zu bekommen, denn mancherorts verschwinden die K√∂rper der Ungeheuer nach ihrem Tod in ihren jeweiligen unteren Dimensionen, aber dort, wo der Leichnam √ºberlebt, kann das Fleisch geerntet werden. Das Fleisch ist z√§h genug, um typische Eisenmesser stumpf werden zu lassen. Deshalb kochen viele das Fleisch in einem langsamen Kocher vor, um es zart zu machen, und grillen es anschlie√üend. Dies geschieht auch deshalb, weil die Temperaturen, die zum richtigen Garen des Fleisches erforderlich sind, h√∂her sind als bei den meisten anderen Fleischsorten, n√§mlich nahe dem Schmelzpunkt von Eisen, so dass es oft in Schmiede√∂fen gegart wird. Wenn es jedoch richtig zubereitet ist, hat es einen k√∂stlichen und reichhaltigen Rauchgeschmack, der "wie H√ºhnchen" schmeckt. Beim Kochen ist Vorsicht geboten. Wird es zu wenig gekocht, leidet der Esser, als w√§re er der F√§higkeit der schwarzen Wolke von Achaierai ausgesetzt gewesen. Bei richtiger Zubereitung erh√§lt der Esser jedoch die F√§higkeit, die F√§higkeit "Schwarze Wolke" des Achaierai einmal einzusetzen. Mehrere Mahlzeiten sind nicht stapelbar, eine Kreatur kann also immer nur eine schwarze Wolke haben.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Die Art der Wolke h√§ngt von der Vorbereitung ab - DC 14 (Nebelwolke); DC 18 (Stinkende Wolke); DC 22 - Wolkentod. Sie h√§lt an, bis sie sich ohne Konzentration entl√§dt. Der Esser ist immun gegen seine eigene schwarze Wolke, ebenso wie andere Achaierais. Schutzw√ºrfe f√ºr die Wolke basieren auf dem Zauber-/F√§higkeits-DC des Essers (8+F√§higkeitsbonus + F√§higkeitsmodifikator (wenn die Klasse der Kreatur keine solche F√§higkeit hat, verwende den F√§higkeitsmodifikator Konstitution)) Dieser Effekt ist nicht stapelbar. Du kannst nur die Effekte von 2 Nahrungsmitteln auf einmal haben.

item.name: Gut Shaker
entries: {@bold Description} (dem Spieler zugewandt): Gelb-braun, viel K√∂rper;Hergestellt aus fermentierter Ziegenmilch und einer eigenen Mischung psychoaktiver, tiefer Pilze, ist dieses von Battleragern bevorzugte Zwergengebr√§u nichts f√ºr schwache Nerven oder den Magen. {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Du wirst w√ºtend, wie die F√§higkeit des Barbaren, aber du kannst dies 1 Minute lang nicht freiwillig beenden; nachdem der Effekt abgeklungen ist, erh√§ltst du eine Stufe der Ersch√∂pfung

item.name: Hangman's Noose

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Der Verbraucher sp√ºrt, wie ihn eine Depression √ºberkommt. Wenn er bereits deprimiert ist, verst√§rkt dieser Effekt jede Wut, jeden Groll, jedes Selbstmitleid, jede Traurigkeit und alle anderen negativen Emotionen, die seinen Geist tr√ºben. Er erleidet einen vor√ºbergehenden Malus von 1d12 auf Weisheit, der 12 Stunden lang anh√§lt.

Zuerst schmeckt es ein bisschen bitter, aber wenn man die "Haut" oben drauf schluckt, wird es s√º√ü... und dann w√ºrzig. Sehr w√ºrzig. Sobald das Getr√§nk "w√ºrzig" wird

Wenn er erfolgreich ist, erh√§lt er eine Stunde lang einen Leistungszuwachs von +2, aber wenn er versagt, schreit er die n√§chsten f√ºnf Minuten lang und wird wahrscheinlich aus dem Haus geworfen, in dem er gerade ist...

item.name: Heart of the Halls

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Das Trinken dieses Getr√§nks kann den Tod, einen teilweisen Intelligenzverlust oder nur einen leichten Rausch verursachen. item.name: Icecap Ale

Au√üerdem verliert der Trinker alle Erinnerungen an Ereignisse, die sich in den 10 Minuten unmittelbar nach dem Genuss eines Schluckes Eiskapsel-Ale ereignet haben; ein erfolgreicher DC 18 Konstitutionsschutz negiert diesen Ged√§chtnisverlust. Weitere Dosen Eisbier, die innerhalb einer Stunde nach der ersten Dosis getrunken werden, f√ºhren dazu, dass der Trinker f√ºr 10 Minuten vergiftet wird (anstatt einen Bonus auf St√§rke und Konstitution zu erhalten) und alle negativen Auswirkungen von Eisbier erleidet.

item.name: Jelly Drink

item.name: Karura's Cactus Fruit
entries: {@bold Description} (Spielerseite): Die Kaktusfrucht von Karura, die auf dem Opuntia-Kaktus w√§chst, ist eine gro√üartige Quelle f√ºr Nahrung und Feuchtigkeit. Der Verzehr dieser Frucht verleiht dem Esser au√üerdem die Wirkung des Zaubers Elemente ertragen. Man findet sie nur in Karuratempeln, die Quellen mit reinem Wasser enthalten. Um sie zu z√ºchten, ist eine Fertigkeitspr√ºfung Kr√§uterkunde DC 14 erforderlich. Jede Opuntia produziert 2 Karuras Kaktusfr√ºchte in nur 1 Tag, aber es wachsen keine neuen, bis sie gepfl√ºckt werden. Einmal gepfl√ºckt, halten sie sich nur 1 Woche lang, bis sie verderben und ihre Wirkung verlieren. Normalerweise werden sie von Tempelklerikern gepflegt und geerntet, um verkauft zu werden. Einem Anh√§nger Karuras wird normalerweise ein Preisnachlass von 25 % gew√§hrt, nachdem er ihm gehuldigt hat. Versucht man, sie au√üerhalb des Tempels anzubauen, bringen sie keine Fr√ºchte hervor.

Wenn du eine Tasse Tee der √úbertragung trinkst, kannst du 1 Punkt aus deinem Ki-Pool aufwenden, um 1 Punkt aus deinem Arkan-Pool, 2 Runden Barbarenwut, 2 Runden bardische Darbietung, einen Einsatz von Energie kanalisieren, 1 Kornpunkt, einen Einsatz von Das B√∂se bannen, einen verbrauchten Extraktplatz, der mindestens 1 Stufe niedriger ist als der h√∂chste Extrakt, den du erschaffen kannst, oder einen verbrauchten Zauberplatz, der mindestens 2 Stufen niedriger ist als der h√∂chste Zauber, den du wirken kannst, wiederzuerlangen. item.name: The Beveridge Brew

{@bold Feature} (GM zugewandt): Wenn Verbraucher einen Konstitutionsschutz von DC 7 bestehen, erhalten sie f√ºr die n√§chsten 24 Stunden +5 auf √úberredung. Wenn sie scheitern, werden sie zu einem zuf√§lligen Zeitpunkt innerhalb der n√§chsten 24 Stunden f√ºr 1 Stunde zu {@condition blinded}.

item.name: Caramel Apples

Die ungew√∂hnlich gro√üe Gr√∂√üe der Truthahnkeulen und die Tatsache, dass sie oft mit Salz gep√∂kelt werden (was ihnen einen seltsam schinken√§hnlichen Geschmack verleiht), hat zu Ger√ºchten gef√ºhrt, dass "Truthahnkeulen" in Wirklichkeit Keulen von etwas anderem sein k√∂nnten...

item.name: Helm Of Hands-Free Carousing

Beide Kr√ºge k√∂nnen mit Bier gef√ºllt werden, so dass der Tr√§ger trinken kann, w√§hrend er beide H√§nde f√ºr Spiele, Schl√§gereien oder das Doppelschwingen von Putenkeulen frei hat.

recipe.name: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} H√§hnchenbrusth√§lften ohne Knochen und ohne Haut

instructions: In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup of the chili sauce, 1 tablespoon of the oil, and garlic. Cut chicken into 16 strips and add to chili-sauce mixture; cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
Preheat broiler. Thread 1 chicken strip onto each skewer.‚Ä† Broil 4 to 6 minutes per side or until no longer pink (165¬∞F).
Arrange cabbage on a serving platter. Place skewers on top. Sprinkle with cilantro and peanuts.

For peanut sauce, in a small bowl whisk together peanut butter, vinegar, soy sauce, honey, remaining 2 tablespoons chili sauce and remaining 2 teaspoons oil until well-combined. Drizzle on chicken skewers and cabbage, and serve.

{=amount1/v} Teel√∂ffel Thymian, fein gehackt (getrocknet ist gut - zerdr√ºckt)

instructions: In a large sauce pan, heat oil, add the celery, onion and carrot.  Cook until tender,but not brown.

completely mix chicken broth and the thickener (squash or cauliflower), then add it to the saucepan.  Add bayleaf, apple, lemon peel, salt, pepper, thyme, and your raisin/prunes.  Let simmer for 15 minutes (or reduce to desired thickness)
add chicken [and rice if off paleo], and heat through.  Add the milk right before serving.

entries: Aus dem Chevys & Rio Bravo TexMex Kochbuch

ingredients.name: Salsa Chicken
entries: 1 Jalape√±o, entstielt, entkernt und halbiert (Handschuhe verwenden)
1 3 bis 4 Pfund gekochtes Huhn, enth√§utet und in St√ºcke geschnitten

instructions.name: Fuego Spice Mix
entries: Alle Zutaten gut verr√ºhren. In einem luftdicht verschlossenen Beh√§lter, gesch√ºtzt vor direktem Licht, bis zu 6 Monate aufbewahren.

Gro√üartige feurige Gew√ºrzmischung zum W√ºrzen von gegrillten Steaks, Koteletts, Gefl√ºgel und Fisch. Reiben Sie das Fleisch direkt vor dem Garen damit ein... Sie k√∂nnen auch eine Prise zu ged√ºnstetem/ged√ºnstetem Gem√ºse hinzuf√ºgen. Oder verwenden Sie es zum W√ºrzen von Tortilla-Chips, Pommes frites oder Popcorn... auch im Rezept f√ºr Salsa-H√ºhnchen verwendet.

instructions.name: Salsa Chicken
entries: Broiler vorheizen. Tomaten und Jalape√±o mit der Schnittfl√§che nach unten in eine Auflaufform legen. Eine der Zwiebelh√§lften halbieren und in die Auflaufform geben. Das Gem√ºse 8 bis 10 Minuten unter dem Grill r√∂sten oder bis es anf√§ngt, schwarz zu werden. Aus dem Ofen nehmen und abk√ºhlen lassen. Das Gem√ºse und die dazugeh√∂rige Fl√ºssigkeit in einen Mixer geben und pulsieren, bis es dick und st√ºckig ist.

Die restlichen drei Viertel der Zwiebel w√ºrfeln und das Oliven√∂l in einer gro√üen Pfanne bei mittlerer Hitze erhitzen. Zwiebel und Knoblauch hinzuf√ºgen und 5 Minuten anbraten. Die Gew√ºrzmischung hinzuf√ºgen und weitere 3 bis 4 Minuten anbraten. H√§hnchenteile zugeben und unter h√§ufigem R√ºhren anbraten, bis das H√§hnchen durchgebraten ist. Die Tomatenmischung in die Pfanne geben und abl√∂schen, dabei umr√ºhren und den Boden der Pfanne abkratzen, um alle gebr√§unten St√ºcke zu l√∂sen. Koriander hinzuf√ºgen. Die Mischung zum K√∂cheln bringen. 10 Minuten k√∂cheln lassen. Vom Herd nehmen und als F√ºllung f√ºr Enchiladas verwenden oder Bohnen hinzuf√ºgen und als F√ºllung f√ºr Burritos verwenden. Mit K√§se, geraspeltem Salat und Guacamole, saurer Sahne oder Salsa garnieren.

recipe.name: Egg Nog
instructions: Combine eggs, milk, and vanilla thoroughly
in a small bowl whip the Cream to soft peaks, and then fold gently into the milk mixture.

recipe.name: RED CURRY (Panang Curry)

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Pfund entbeintes, hautloses H√ºhnerfleisch (Schenkel sind gut und werden traditionell in mundgerechte St√ºcke geschnitten)
{=amount1/v} 1 Tasse Bambus aus der Dose - oder Sie bereiten alles aus Bambussprossen zu (in d√ºnne Streifen geschnitten)
{=amount1/v} - {=amount2/v} Thai Long Chilis (die roten sind sch√§rfer/reifer; die gr√ºnen sind milder)
~{amount1/v} Tasse s√º√ües Thai-Basilikum (Horapah, Stern von Siam)

instructions: Heat half of the coconut milk in a wok or pan, bringing it to slow boil and then adding the ¬Ω curry paste.

While doing that (coming to boil) -- Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces. Chop the onions and peppers into rough 1-inch pieces. Mince the garlic. Tear the steam out of the Kaffir Lime leaves then cut into strips to help release their oils (set aside).

Place a 14-inch skillet (or wok) over medium-high heat. Add the coconut oil. Once the oil melts, add the onions. Saut√© for 1 minute, then add one or two of the peppers and garlic. Add remaining curry paste (and peanut butter) Saut√© another 2-3 minutes to intensify the flavor, moving around the pan.
(Coconut milk should be in a boil now, add the curry paste/remaining coconut milk and chicken, onions, bamboo shoots, eggplant, ginger, sugar & garlic.)
Bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce thickens. Stir occasionally.
Add the cut Cut the veggies, remaining chilies and some of the basil during the last 5 minutes of simmer, and remaining chilies.
Remove from heat. Garnish with remaining kaffir lime leaves sprigs of basil, add fish sauce to taste.  Serve with rice, quinoa, or noodles.
noteCook: The best thing I can think of to make Thai curries is to use plenty of aromatics, like onion, ginger, and garlic.
Choose full-fat coconut milk for its richness.
Stirring in just a little bit more fish sauce and sugar adds tons of complexity.
If it tastes a bit salty at the end, it's ok, as the rice - especially if its coconut rice - will moderate that.

recipe.name: Mulligatawny Soup Recipe with Jasmine Rice

entries: Diese schnelle und einfache Version von Mulligatawny ist standardm√§√üig vegetarisch - ich f√ºge meinem Mulligatawny kein traditionelles Huhn hinzu. Aber wenn Sie es vorziehen, H√ºhnerfleisch hinzuzuf√ºgen, empfehle ich Freilandhaltung und biologische Aufzucht.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Essl√∂ffel Thai Kitchen Gr√ºne oder Rote Currypaste oder GF-Currypulver, nach Geschmack
Saft von {=amount1/v} oder {=amount2/v} mittleren Limetten, je nach Bedarf

ingredients: Sea salt and fresh ground pepper, to taste
Finely diced red onion, apple, or chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
instructions: Heat the olive oil over medium high heat in a medium size soup pot. Add the curry paste and stir briefly to season the oil. Add in the onion, garlic, carrots, celery, apples and sweet potato; stir and cook until softened, about 7 minutes.
Stir in the vegetable broth. Bring to a high simmer and then cover the pot; reduce the heat and simmer the soup, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 20 to 30 minutes.
Add the coconut milk, a squeeze of lime juice and a touch of agave or raw sugar. Stir with love. Taste for seasoning adjustments. Could it use more lime to tart it up a bit? A little salt and pepper?
Adjust the seasonings to your liking. Heat through gently; don't boil.

Puree the soup with a handheld immersion blender (you could also puree in small batches, covered tightly, in a blender or a food processor; hold the lid on, though as hot soup sputters and expands when it is blended). Return the puree to the soup pot.
Stir in the drained chick peas. Heat through on low heat until serving.

Note: If you prefer a little more texture, you can also puree only half the soup- or mash it lightly with a potato masher until you have the consistency you desire. Then add the chick peas and warm through.
Serve the mulligatawny with a garnish of diced red onion, apple or cilantro. Offer a side of hot cooked jasmine rice.
Add a spoonful of rice to the soup as you eat it. Delicious!

recipe.name: Southwestern Chili

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} lb gro√üe wei√üe Bohnen, √ºber Nacht in Wasser eingeweicht, abgetropft

instructions: Combine beans, chicken broth, garlic and half the onions in a large soup pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are very soft, 3 hours or more. Add additional water (or watered-down broth), if necessary.

In a skillet, saut√© remaining onions in oil until tender. Add chilies and seasonings and mix thoroughly. Add to bean mixture. Add chicken and continue to simmer 1 hour. Check seasoning, add jalapeno or serrano to level of desired hotness.
Serve topped with grated cheese. Garnish with cilantro, chopped fresh tomato, salsa, chopped scallions, and/or guacamole. Serve with fresh warmed flour tortillas or tortilla chips.

recipe.name: Chicken/Tortellini/Spinach Soup

entries: Dieses Suppenrezept enth√§lt H√§hnchenbrustst√ºcke, Pilze, K√§setortellini, Spinat und Gew√ºrze.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Packung (8 bis 10 Unzen) Tortellini mit Frischk√§sef√ºllung
{=amount1/v} Pfund entbeinte, hautlose H√ºhnerbr√ºste, in 1/2-Zoll-St√ºcke geschnitten

instructions: Rinse, drain and chop spinach leaves. In an 8 to 10-quart kettle or Dutch oven, bring the chicken broth to a boil over high heat.
Add spinach, chicken, mushrooms, rice, and basil, then return to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for about 3 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in the center.
Add tortellini and bell pepper, and cook for about 4 minutes, just until tender.
Ladle into bowls and pass the Parmesan cheese.

recipe.name: Grilled Chicken Satay

entries.entry: {=amount1/v} H√ºhnerbrust ohne Knochen und Haut, in 1-Zoll-St√ºcke geschnitten
Saft von {=amount1/v} Limette oder {=amount2/v} Essl√∂ffel Limettensaft

instructions: Place all the ingredients for sauce in a food processor or blender, mix until smooth almost like a smoothie texture, should take about 30 seconds
Using the sauce, use about 1/3 of it to marinade your chicken chunks or whole chicken in the refrigerator for anywhere from 3 hours to 2 days
Once your ready to cook your chicken, preheat your grill on high for about 10 minutes, then turn down to medium around 450-500 degrees
Use your skewers and slam that chicken on the grill and cook for about 6 minutes per side or until done, best practice is only to flip once
Serve with some freshly sauteed vegetables or over a bed of Cauliflower CousCous garnished with pineapple.

recipe.name: Sweet and Sour Grilled Chicken

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ganze H√ºhnerbr√ºste ohne Knochen und Haut, halbiert

instructions: In a shallow bowl, whisk together garlic, vinegar, lime and lemon juices, brown sugar, mustard, honey, salt and pepper. Whisk in olive oil.
Divide sauce into thirds. Reserve one portion of the mixture for basting and one for dipping sauce, then add chicken to the dish with the remaining portion and turn it to coat.

Grill chicken 4 to 5 minutes per side or until the juices run clear. During the last minutes of cooking, baste the chicken with the portion of the reserved sauce to glaze it. Garnish with Italian parsley, if desired. Serve with other reserved portion of sauce for dipping.

recipe.name: Ultimate Cheeseburger
instructions: Let's start COOKING!
Roast Corn, Jalapenos and Garlic, and mostly cook the bacon - reserve the grease

instructions.name: The Burger Mixture.
entries: ¬Ω Zwiebel fein hacken, Speck w√ºrfeln, Knoblauch zu einer Paste zerkleinern
In einer Sch√ºssel Schweine- und Rindfleisch, BBQ-So√üe, Zwiebel, Speck, Eiwei√ü, Knoblauch, Taragon und Paprika vermischen und durchmischen.
Gew√ºrfelten Speck in die Burgermischung geben

instructions.name: Corn Relish
entries: Jalapeno w√ºrfeln und zum Mais geben
Zucker, Zwiebelw√ºrfel, Zitronenschale und Apfelessig hinzuf√ºgen

instructions.name: Whiskey Onions
entries: In einer Pfanne Speckfett und Butter erhitzen.
Caynne, einen Tropfen Fl√ºssigrauch und Whiskey hinzuf√ºgen
anbraten und vom Herd nehmen bzw. das Speckfett aufbewahren.

instructions.name: Chiptole Mayo
entries: Knoblauch mit Mayo, Zitronenschale und Chiptole in eine Sch√ºssel geben.

instructions.name: Burger Stuffing

K√§se reiben, vermengen und beiseite stellen.
Nehmen Sie die Burger-Mischung und streichen Sie sie aus, bis sie etwa 1/4" d√ºnn ist, und formen Sie dann mit einer Sch√ºssel oder einem Ausstecher mehrere ~6" Patties.
Eine Frikadelle zur Seite nehmen und ca. 2 EL K√§semischung in die Mitte der Frikadelle geben, dann die R√§nder der Frikadelle √ºber den K√§se klappen und die Frikadellenmischung verschlie√üen.
das √ºbersch√ºssige Speckfett nehmen und die Burger auf einer Seite damit begie√üen
die Burger grillen, dabei nur einmal umdrehen
Mayo, Zwiebeln, auf Br√∂tchen Ihrer Wahl legen

recipe.name: Stuffed Peppers with Chili Verde Sauce

entries.entry: {=amount1/v} bis {=amount2/v} gro√üe Poblano-Paprikaschoten (k√∂nnen auch Pasilla-Paprika genannt werden)
{=amount1/v} Tassen gew√ºrfelte S√º√ükartoffeln, gesch√§lt (oder Butternussk√ºrbis f√ºr SCD)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Boil the tomatillos and serrano pepper for 10-15 minutes, or until the skins have shriveled slightly and the fruit has turned a dull army green. Drain and remove any stems.

Meanwhile, brown the beef in a deep skillet over medium heat until cooked through. Drain the grease and return the beef to the pan. Add the sweet potatoes, onion, carrots, spinach, and spices. Saut√© for 15 minutes until the vegetables have softened slightly.
To make the sauce: add the tomatillos and serrano peppers to a blender or food processor. Blend with the onion, garlic, and sea salt until smooth.
Cut a slit lengthwise on the top of each pepper. Gently scrape out the seeds from the inside the peppers and discard.
Stuff each pepper generously with the mixture being careful not to tear the pepper.
Spoon ¬º cup sauce over each pepper. Pour the remaining sauce into the bottom of a large baking dish and arrange the peppers in the dish.
Bake, covered, for 15 minutes, then uncovered for 15 minutes until the peppers are soft and the sauce is hot.
Serve with avocado or guacamole.

recipe.name: Winter Squash Soup with Roasted Pumpkin Seeds

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} 4 Pfund Kabocha- oder Butternussk√ºrbis - gesch√§lt, entkernt und in 1-Zoll-W√ºrfel geschnitten

ingredients: Salt and freshly ground white pepper
Large pinch of freshly grated nutmeg
Salted roasted pumpkin seeds, honey and diced cucumber, for garnish (optional)
instructions: In a large pot, melt the butter. Add the onion, celery and garlic and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the white wine and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the stock and water and bring to a boil. Add the squash, cover partially and simmer over moderately low heat until tender, about 30 minutes.

Working in batches, puree the soup in a blender. Return the soup to the pot, bring to a simmer and season with salt, white pepper and nutmeg. Garnish with the pumpkin seeds, a drizzle of honey and the cucumber.
MAKE AHEAD The soup can be refrigerated for up to 2 days. Reheat before serving.

recipe.name: Breakfast Lasagna

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Tasse Butter, geschmolzen, plus mehr zum Einfetten der F√∂rmchen

instructions: For the pancakes: Mix together the buttermilk, milk, three eggs, and melted butter in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together three cups flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and a large pinch of salt. Slowly whisk the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until incorporated.

In a large buttered skillet, ladle one cup of batter at a time. Brown each side, flipping when browned and beginning to bubble. Remove the pancake, and repeat until all of the batter is cooked. Square off the edges of each pancake.

For the bacon: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Fit a cooling rack into a half-sheet pan. Arrange the bacon on top of the cooling rack and bake until crispy, 15 to 20 minutes. Reserve one-half cup of the rendered bacon fat.
For the sausage: Line a half-sheet pan with sausage links, and bake in the oven until cooked through.
Roughly chop the sausage, and add it to a food processor with the sage. Pulse until finely chopped.
For the eggs: In a large bowl, whisk nine eggs with a large punch of salt until smooth, and cook in a large buttered skillet, stirring frequently, over medium heat until fluffy and cooked through.
Transfer to a blender, add one-half cup cream, and pur√©e until smooth.

For the maple b√©chamel: And the reserved bacon fat to a large sauce pot set over medium heat. Once melted, whisk in flour. Cook for three to four minutes, whisking frequently to get rid of the raw flour flavor. Add two cups cream, the maple syrup, and a large pinch of salt, and cook over low heat, stirring until thickened and the consistency of gravy.

To assemble the lasagna: Butter a casserole dish, and completely line the bottom with a single layer of pancakes. Lightly spread the b√©chamel over the pancakes until covered. Arrange the chopped sausage on top of the pancakes, spreading evenly. Spoon one-half of the egg mixture over the sausage, and spread until evenly distributed. Add another layer of the b√©chamel, and then add a layer of shredded cheese. Add another layer of pancakes, then b√©chamel, then bacon strips, b√©chamel again, then the rest of the eggs, and finish with a liberal covering of cheese.
Bake in a 375¬∞F oven until the cheese has melted on top and begun to get crispy. Let cool, then slice into portions.
Reheat each portion before serving, and serve with maple syrup.

recipe.name: Mexican Quiche

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Schachtel gek√ºhlte Kuchenkrusten, aufgeweicht nach Anleitung auf der Schachtel

instructions: Heat oven to 425¬∞F. In 8-inch skillet, cook sausage over medium heat, stirring frequently, until browned and no longer pink; drain.
Set aside to cool.
In medium bowl, mix both cheeses and chiles.
Stir in cooled cooked sausage.
In another medium bowl, beat eggs thoroughly with fork.
Stir in salsa.

Remove pie crusts from pouches; place flat on work surface. With rolling pin, roll each crust into 12-inch round. With 3 1/2-inch round cutter, cut 22 rounds from crusts, rerolling scraps as necessary.
Press each round into ungreased muffin cup or fluted tartet pan.
Spoon 1 heaping tablespoon cheese mixture into each crust-lined cup. Top each with about 1 tablespoon egg mixture; divide any remaining egg mixture between cups.
Bake 14 to 18 minutes or until filling is set. If desired, garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Fried Apple Pie
recipe.makes: several small bit sized pocket pies

entries.entry: {=amount1/v} Tasse ungesalzene Butter, sehr kalt, in {=amount1*16} St√ºcke geschnitten
{=amount1/v} Tasse Schmalz, sehr kalt, in 4 St√ºcke geschnitten
{=amount1/v} Granny-Smith-√Ñpfel, gesch√§lt, entkernt und in 1/2-Zoll-W√ºrfel geschnitten
{=amount1/v} Golden Delicious √Ñpfel, gesch√§lt, entkernt und in 1/2-Zoll-W√ºrfel geschnitten
{=amount1/v} Tasse Zucker gemischt mit 2 Essl√∂ffeln gemahlenem Zimt

instructions.name: Pie Dough
entries: Das Mehl mit dem Salz und dem Zucker in einer gro√üen Sch√ºssel verquirlen. Die H√§lfte der Butter und des Schmalzes in das Mehl einarbeiten, dann die Fette mit einer K√ºchenmaschine, einem Messer oder den Fingern zerkleinern, bis sie erbsengro√ü oder etwas kleiner sind. Die restliche Butter und das restliche Schmalz in die Mischung einarbeiten, bis die Mischung grobk√∂rnig ist und einige gr√∂√üere Fettbrocken enth√§lt.

Mit dem Finger einen Graben in der Mitte der Mischung ziehen und etwa 2 Essl√∂ffel des Wassers in den Graben und um das Mehl herum tr√§ufeln. Mit den Fingern oder einem Gummispatel das Mehl mit dem Wasser vermengen. Wiederholen Sie diesen Vorgang, bis sich der Teig zu zotteligen Klumpen zusammenf√ºgt. Drehen Sie den Teig auf ein leicht bemehltes Brett und streichen Sie mit dem Handballen Teigst√ºcke von sich weg. Nehmen Sie den Teig mit einem Teigschaber zusammen und dr√ºcken Sie ihn zu einer gro√üen Scheibe. Fest einwickeln und vor der Verwendung einige Stunden in den K√ºhlschrank stellen.

Den Teig auf einer leicht bemehlten Fl√§che etwas dicker als 1/8-Zoll ausrollen. Kreise von 5 Zoll ausstechen, auf Pergamentpapier auf ein Backblech legen und k√ºhl stellen, w√§hrend Sie die F√ºllung zubereiten.

instructions.name: Filling
entries: Die Butter in einer gro√üen Sauteuse bei starker Hitze schmelzen. Den braunen Zucker hinzuf√ºgen und unter gelegentlichem R√ºhren kochen, bis die Mischung leicht eindickt, etwa 5 Minuten. Den Calvados hinzugeben und 1 Minute lang kochen.

Die √Ñpfel hinzuf√ºgen und 5 Minuten kochen, dabei gelegentlich umr√ºhren. Zitronensaft, Zimt und Ingwer hinzuf√ºgen und kochen, bis die √Ñpfel karamellisiert und gerade durchgebraten sind, etwa 10 Minuten l√§nger. In eine flache Sch√ºssel oder auf ein Backblech schaben und auf Zimmertemperatur abk√ºhlen lassen.

instructions.name: Assembly
entries: Einen der Teigkreise auf eine flache Oberfl√§che legen und einige Essl√∂ffel der Apfelf√ºllung auf eine H√§lfte jedes Teigkreises geben. Den Teig mit etwas kaltem Wasser bestreichen und in der Mitte falten, so dass die andere Seite √ºber die Apfelf√ºllung kommt. Den Kuchen verschlie√üen und einen dekorativen Rand formen, indem man die Teigr√§nder mit der R√ºckseite einer Gabel zusammendr√ºckt. Legen Sie die Kuchen auf ein mit Pergamentpapier ausgelegtes Backblech und lassen Sie sie 30 Minuten lang kalt stellen.

Das √ñl in einem gro√üen Topf erhitzen, bis es auf einem Frittierthermometer 360 Grad F erreicht. Die Pasteten, jeweils 2 auf einmal, ca. 2 Minuten lang goldbraun frittieren. Mit einem Schauml√∂ffel auf ein mit Papierhandt√ºchern ausgelegtes Backblech geben. 10 Sekunden abtropfen lassen und dann mit dem Zimtzucker bestreuen. Servieren.

recipe.name: Creme Brulee

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} 1 Vanilleschote, aufgeschnitten und ausgekratzt (oder 2 Essl√∂ffel Vanilleextrakt)

ingredients: nutmeg to taste (for an eggnog brulee)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325¬∞F.
Place the cream, vanilla bean and its pulp into a medium saucepan set over medium-high heat and bring to a boil.
Remove from the heat, cover and allow to sit for 15 minutes.
Remove the vanilla bean and reserve for another use.
In a medium bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup sugar and the egg yolks until well blended and it just starts to lighten in color.
Add the cream a little at a time, stirring continually.
Pour the liquid into 6 (7 to 8-ounce) ramekins.
Place the ramekins into a large cake pan or roasting pan.
Pour enough hot water into the pan to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake just until the creme brulee is set, but still trembling in the center, approximately 40 to 45 minutes.
Remove the ramekins from the roasting pan and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 3 days.
Remove the creme brulee from the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes prior to browning the sugar on top.
Divide the remaining 1/2 cup vanilla sugar equally among the 6 dishes and spread evenly on top.
Using a torch, melt the sugar and form a crispy top.
Allow the creme brulee to sit for at least 5 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: The Cook

entries: Diminutiven sind {@b {@i not}} akzeptabel, wenn der Keks so gro√ü ist!

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Tasse dunkler brauner Zucker (bei Verwendung von hellem Zucker mehr Vanilleextrakt hinzuf√ºgen)
{=amount1/v} Dose Pudding mit Geschmack (ich habe wei√üe Schokolade verwendet)
{=amount1/v} Teel√∂ffel Kaffeesatz (verwendet - wenn Sie keinen Kaffeegeschmack m√∂gen)

instructions: Butter should be soft almost, but not quite room temperature.
In a large bowl Cream Butter, Crisco and then add sugars until well blended.
add 1 whipped egg, vanilla, and Milk/Cream.
Try to keep the mixture cool (you may need to refrigerate)
Blending in pudding slowly (make sure this is well incorporated and the mixture doesn't appear granulated)
In a smaller bowl combine Flour, Baking Soda, & Salt
Then mix in peanut butter, add the cut oats.
Slowly add the dry mixture bowl's content.
Add Chocolate Chunks.
Make into several palm sized balls (approximate 5-6 per batch) and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
Warm oven to 325 F (and locate the exhaust flue for the oven)
Place balls on tray (I suggest a baking sheet or parchment paper and not a greased tray)
Cook for approximately 25 minutes (this is tricky because I always just use the sense of smell for this)
then remove and place them under the exhaust flu for another 15 minutes, (or into a cold convection for 8-10 minutes @ 250 - that's a guess) to get the outside shell dried out and crispy.

recipe.name: Three Halflings in a Trench Coat

entries: Bekanntlich gibt es kaum etwas Furchteinfl√∂√üenderes oder Verwirrenderes als die geballte Kraft dreier Halblinge in einem Trenchcoat, die direkt auf einen zukommen. Genauso sind die drei Rumsorten, die sich in einem Mantel aus s√º√üen und sauren S√§ften verstecken, ein wahres Kraftpaket.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Unze Honigsirup (siehe Rezept in Tavern Basics)
{=amount1/v} Unzen Club Soda (oder genug zum Auff√ºllen)

instructions: Combine rums, juices, and syrup in an ice-filled shaker and shake well to combine and chill.
Strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Fill to top with club soda.
Garnish with skewered orange wheel and cherries.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Urspr√ºnglich waren es nur zwei Halblinge im Trenchcoat, und das auch nur, um in Bars und verbotene Kinos zu kommen. Erst als sich ein unternehmungslustiger Dritter hinzugesellte, sollte die Welt die wahre Macht einer wabbeligen Masse mit sechs Armen und einem eleganten Sinn f√ºr Mode kennenlernen.

recipe.name: Dark Elf

entries: Tief in den Nischen der Unterwelt schmieden die schattenhaften Dunkelelfen im Stockdunkel der ewigen Nacht Pl√§ne und schmieden Verschw√∂rungen. In der Dunkelheit zu sitzen und Verschw√∂rungen zu schmieden, ist nicht besonders sexy. Deshalb sitzen sie oft an schicken Tischen und trinken exotische Unterwelt-Cocktails, die aus geheimen, b√∂sartigen Zutaten hergestellt werden. Da b√∂sartige Zutaten oft nicht Delphin-sicher oder frei von GVO sind, haben wir versucht, die umbralen Nektare, die diese Elfen genie√üen, mit einfachen Zutaten nachzubilden.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounces cherry juice (as dark as possible)
{=amount1/v} stemmed and pitted dark fresh cherries (such as Bing or Sweetheart)

instructions: 1. Combine rum, schnapps, cherry juice, and grenadine in an icefilled shaker.
2. Shake vigorously to mix and chill. Strain into a martini glass.
3. Garnish with a toothpick spear of alternating fresh and maraschino cherries.

recipe.name: Gnomish Gnightcap

entries: Gnomes are gnown for having gnightcaps that are gnothing short of magnificent. Bitter, sweet, dry, and refreshing all at once, this drink is every bit as complex as any gnomish invention but exceedingly easy to make.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except orange twist together in an icefilled shaker. Shake vigorously to combine and chill.
2. Strain into a tumbler or highball glass over cubed ice.
3. Garnish with orange twist.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The tradition of ending an evening with a drink is attributed to Delbar Tippletinkler, a hero among the gnomish people. Originally, the drink had a sprinkle of dirt in it as well. Not on purpose. That's just what happens when you make all your drinks in a burrow.

Dwarves are master craftsmen, known far and wide for their attention to detail, resistance to the heat of their mighty furnaces, and mastery over the blend of artistry and function. To pay proper homage to the stout axe-loving folk, this cocktail is a challenge to make and a reward to master. It's also on fire, so be extremely careful and follow all the recommended safety instructions.

instructions.name: For the Spiced Berry Coulis:
entries: Combine berries, thyme, sugar, and water in a medium saucepan.
Cook over medium heat to boiling, stirring until all sugar has dissolved and the fruit has fully softened, roughly 8 minutes.
Remove mixture from the heat, transfer to a medium bowl, and refrigerate until cold, at least 1 hour.
Strain mixture through a sieve into a storage bottle (a funnel may help here), then add the drops of food coloring for extra color.

instructions.name: For the Cocktail:
entries: Combine all ingredients except overproof rum in an ice-filled shaker and shake to combine and chill.
Strain into a coupe glass, leaving room at the top of the glass.
Slowly pour overproof rum over the back of a spoon into the glass to form a layer over top of cocktail (be careful not to fill the glass).

Light cocktail with a match and observe. Safety note: Do not move cocktail or consume cocktail while still lit. Do not attempt to blow out a flaming cocktail. To put out, smother the fire with a saucer or cocktail shaker. Do not allow the fire to "burn out," as alcohol fires can be invisible. Always ensure fire is safely out before consuming.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: For maximum Dwarven Forge showiness, wait until this drink is lit and burning, then from a safe distance above the flames, sprinkle a pinch of cinnamon down from above. This will create beautiful forge sparks, which dwarves hold in high esteem (at beard's length, of course).

recipe.name: Aasimartini

entries: A cocktail as holy as drinking can legally be outside of a church or temple, the Aasimartini distills divinity into a delightful package. While the aasimar merely has an angel or two somewhere in the family tree, the Aasimartini delivers glory on high and a pleasant coffee aroma to boot.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except garnish in an ice-filled shaker and shake well to combine.
2. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with star fruit slice.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Several variations on this cocktail exist, from the Half-Celestial Templarita to the Deva & Coke, but we've elected to include the original, because that's the lawful good thing to do.

recipe.name: Half 'n' Half-Orc

entries: Half-orcs have a hard time fitting into society. They are rejected by their brutal orcish cousins and treated as dangerous criminals and monsters by their human relatives. There is, however, a fierce nobility to these folk, and those that do befriend them are rewarded, in this case by a refreshing blend of mint and cream that's accepted by just about everyone.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and mix gently.
2. Strain into a chilled martini glass.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The Half 'n' Half-Orc is best garnished with mint leaves, but also commonly with dark chocolate shavings. Learning to trim these shavings with a twohanded greataxe can be rough going at first, but it's a rewarding process you'll learn to appreciate.

recipe.name: Sleep Immunity

entries: Among the many things that elves are known for, perhaps one of the lesser-known qualities is their inherent sleeplessness and inability to be put in magical slumber. With this caffeine concoction, you, too, can feel what it's like to be one of the fair folk, at least for a time.

ingredients: 1 (8-ounce) can energy drink of choice (larger is fine)
instructions: 1. Pour vodka into a highball glass filled with ice.
2. Top up with energy drink.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Since its creation, this particular cocktail has been highly popular with those that wish to feel some of the power of elven kind flowing through them. There is a much less popular dwarven drink that lets you detect the slope of a floor—probably because it accomplishes this by being powerful enough to lay you flat out on the ground.

recipe.name: Tiefling's Breakfast

entries: Tieflings tend to eat like they live, with more than a little smoke, fire, and danger. This beverage serves as a brunch time pick-me-up that the fiendish among you can enjoy for its fiery heat and refreshing tang.

ingredients.entry: Approximately {=amount1/v} ounces tomato juice to fill
{=amount1/v}1 celery stalk for garnish, leaves on

instructions: 1. Fill the bottom of a small bowl with 1 dash celery salt. Rub 1 lime edge around the rim of a pint glass and coat with celery salt.
2. Fill glass with ice and add 2 dashes of celery salt and all other ingredients except tomato juice, celery stalk, and remaining lime wedge.
3. Fill with tomato juice and stir well.
4. Garnish with celery stalk and lime wedge.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: This is not the only drink to be named for the tiefling race. In fact, there is one for every meal of the day. The Tiefling's Brunch tends to just be a mixture of champagne and catty gossip.

recipe.name: Slippery Grippli

entries: If you're looking for green and slippery, you can't go wrong with the tiny batrachian swamp dwellers known as the grippli. Masters of camouflage and ambush, these tiny creatures attack from the shadows in deadly flashes of emerald. To create this cocktail reminiscent of these swamp denizens and their swamp, a layered shooter provides swamp water (the brown of the schnapps), bull rushes (the tan of Irish cream), and frog-fellow (sweet melon liqueur), all in one candy-sweet shot.

instructions: 1. Pour butterscotch schnapps into a shot glass.
2. Carefully pour cream over the back of a spoon so it goes into the glass more slowly, creating a layer of cream over schnapps.
3. Repeat step 2 using melon liqueur.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Applying any garnishes here would really be gilding the foxtail. Honestly, that's probably for the best, as the original garnish suggestions in the guidebook were two isopods on a toothpick and a hellgrammite at the bottom.

recipe.name: Barbarian Rage

entries: Regardless of their homeland or upbringing, one thing all barbarian warriors have in common is the ability to call upon a seemingly inhuman rage while in combat. With this combination of spirits and energy drink, you, too, can feel what it's like to be all brawn and no brains.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} (8-ounce) can energy drink of choice (or larger)

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except energy drink in a shaker with cracked ice, then shake and pour into a pint glass or large mug.
2. Fill with energy drink.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: In a pinch, the cocktail glass can be replaced with the skull of a recently defeated foe. Be aware that this drink will cause you to fly into an energyfueled mania of bad decisions where you may not be able to tell friend from foe. Before going into another rage, take a short rest.

recipe.name: Bard's Songs

entries: When adventuring in the wilds or relaxing in a tavern, nothing can soothe the frayed nerves of a wanderer quite like a song from a bard. This drink has all the sparkle and glamor of the best showmen out there and is just as refreshing as kicking your feet up and listening to a great tune.

instructions: 1. Combine Pimm's No. 1 Cup, gin, lemon juice, and grenadine in an ice-filled pitcher, and stir to combine.
2. Strain equally into six chilled wine flutes. Fill each glass with equal amounts sparkling wine and raspberries.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: One of the great arguments among the magic users of the world is whether a bard's song is actually magic or if they've somehow found a way to inspire through music in a way that seems magical. However, I once saw a bard get an ogre to dance a waltz with a halfling, so I'm going to say magic.

recipe.name: Flavored Enemy

entries: The rangers that wander the wilderness are known to have specific enemies that they come to study and know in great detail. These enemies come in many different flavors, and this is just one flavor that you can master.

instructions: 1. Add vodka and juices to an ice-filled highball glass and stir well.
2. Garnish with orange wheel.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The tradition among rangers to focus on a single type of enemy has a long and storied history to it. You see, one day, a ranger got really lazy and decided to say that he only fought goblinoids so the local town would leave him alone about the giants who were roaming around.

recipe.name: Holy Water

entries: Holy water, when flung on a vampire or other intelligent undead, will repulse the creature and burn its vile hide as it shrinks away from the wielder. That said, actual holy water tastes like water, so it makes a lot of sense to hurl it at itinerant Draculas. This floral twist on the classic margarita tastes holy, so you may wish to retain it for consumption instead.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except lime wheel in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine and chill.
2. Strain and serve in an iced cocktail glass.
3. Garnish with lime wheel.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Warning note: Hurling this drink at a vampire will render his waistcoat and silly red cloak all sticky in the few seconds before he murders you, so consider offering him a glass, instead.

recipe.name: Necromancer

entries: The art of necromancy has often been looked down on as evil and unnatural. While this drink may seem to be as cloudy as the eyes of a newly risen corpse, it has a perfectly balanced flavor with citrusy strength

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except orange twist in an ice-filled shaker
and shake vigorously to combine and chill.
2. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
3. Garnish with orange twist.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Necromancers get a bad rap, and I can understand where most people are coming from. But, for us, there's honestly no one else we would rather turn to when we need some body.

recipe.name: Sneak Attack

entries: Rogues are known for being able to sneak up on the unsuspecting and take them out with one go. This is also true for this deceptively strong drink that masks its power in sweet and refreshing flavors.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounces Luxardo or other maraschino liqueur
{=amount1/v} ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)

instructions: 1. Pour all ingredients into a blender.
2. Blend on the pulse setting until smooth.
3. Pour into a chilled coupe glass.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: This drink used to be known as The Backstabber and was much more difficult to make. Over the years, more enlightened bartenders have made variations of it so that it is much more accessible if maybe less crushingly powerful. Some people still mistakenly call it the wrong name.

recipe.name: Stunning Smite

entries: Paladins can call upon their deity to help them smite evil and leave their foes stunned and reeling. This drink will smite what ails you as the warmth and sweetness spread, leaving all those you serve stunned by how good it is.

instructions: 1. For the Cinnamon Cider: Combine apple cider and 3 cinnamon sticks in a small saucepan and cook over medium heat until simmering, about 3 minutes.
2. Turn off the heat and let mixture cool to room temperature.
3. For the Cocktail: Combine Cinnamon Cider, whiskey, lemon juice, and syrup in an ice-filled shaker and shake to combine.
4. Strain into a tumbler filled with ice.
5. Garnish with apple slices and remaining cinnamon stick.

recipe.name: Sweet and Sour-cerer

entries: The sorcerer is a being of contrasts. They are bestowed with great power and yet have not learned how to properly use it. They are both human and yet something else. In the same way, this cocktail blends both sour and sweet into a drink that is more than it seems.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except lime wheel in an ice-filled shaker and shake to combine.
2. Strain cocktail into an ice-filled tumbler.
3. Garnish with lime wheel.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: "Sorcerers will try to tell you that they don't actually have any dragons in their ancestry and that it's actually just their inherent power. They are liars. Everyone knows that you only get magic powers without studying if your parents slept around with giant lizards."—A wizard

recipe.name: Sword and Chambord

entries: In the wilds of the land, there is little that a warrior can count on aside from their own strength and the weapons they wield. You have to make sure everything is perfectly balanced so that nothing fails you at the worst moment. This drink manages to strike that perfect balance of spicy, sweet, and strong that will leave you refreshed and ready for anything.

instructions: 1. Combine vodka, black raspberry liqueur, and lime juice in an icefilled Moscow mule mug.
2. Top the mug with ginger beer.
3. Garnish with lime wheel and raspberries scattered across the drink surface.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Those discerning drinkers who favor the taste of the Sword and Chambord cocktail will often have similar ideas on how it should be presented. Specifically, it is determined to be best when served in a tankard.

recipe.name: Healing Surge

entries: Here's a blast of refreshing energy, a cool breeze that soothes the burn, and the pick-me-up you were looking for. This sour-sweet elixir will cure what ails you (please note that depending on the spell level of the user, this might only cure specifically any thirst that ails you)

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)
{=amount1/v} slice Granny Smith apple for garnish

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except apple slice and soda in an icefilled shaker and shake vigorously to combine.
2. Fill a cocktail glass with ice and add apple slice.
3. Strain the cocktail into the glass, then fill with soda.
4. Garnish with apple slice.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The best thing about this beverage is that consuming it is only a minor action, leaving you free to attack and move this round. Please only attack in moderation.

recipe.name: Escape Artist

entries: Rogues are often possessed of a slippery talent to loose their bonds and break their chains, sneaking free to pick pockets and find and remove traps again. To commemorate and encapsulate their greasy greatness, try the Escape Artist, a fresh, bright, herbaceous martini well lubricated with olive oil and vodka to keep things loose and lawscoffing.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)
{=amount1/v} ounce plus drizzle extra-virgin olive oil, divided

instructions: 1. Muddle lemon and basil leaves in the bottom of a mixing glass.
2. Add several ice cubes, vodka, syrup, ¬Ω ounce olive oil, and vermouth to glass. Swirl to combine for 30 seconds.
3. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
4. Drizzle remaining olive oil on top to form a small pool. Garnish with lemon twist.

recipe.name: Point Blank Shot

entries: It takes a strong will as an archer to be able to remain cool and collected when someone comes running up to you with their sword out. Taking this shot will also require a steady hand and an open mind, as these two liquors combine into an entirely new flavor.

instructions: 1. Combine gin and whiskey in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine.
2. Strain into a shot glass.
3. Squeeze lemon twist over the shot and hang on the rim as a garnish.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: There was a variation of this drink that was far less popular known as the Far Shot. It involved trying to throw a shot into a friend's mouth, and after many painful eye accidents, it was abandoned.

recipe.name: Seduction Rolls

entries: The art of seduction is a curious thing. There is no single thing that can make one seductive; it is a blend of many different factors. With all the different parts mixed together here, you get one singularly enticing drink that is sweet and tangy and leaves you wanting more.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} tangerines, cut into 16 sections for garnish

instructions: 1. Mix cranberry juice, vodka, Amaretto, and orange juice in a pitcher.
2. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
3. Add 1 cup of mixture to an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously.
4. Strain into two martini glasses and garnish each glass with 2 tangerine sections. Repeat three more times.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: A Seduction Roll is romantic enough to have a chance to work on anyone. The nice thing is, with eight different chances, you're even more likely to find someone that thinks you're as special as your mother always tells everyone.

recipe.name: Power Attack

entries: When fighting an enemy with more meat than brains, you sometimes need to sacrifice a little finesse for a little more raw power. While this drink seems sweet, fruity, and a little tart, it's packing a heck of a punch.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce Southern Comfort (you could substitute any good bourbon here, though be forewarned, this will pump up the alcohol kick)

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except orange juice and orange wedge in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine.
2. Strain into an ice-filled cocktail glass.
3. Fill with orange juice, and garnish with orange wedge.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: You don't always have to swing as hard as you can. Sometimes, it's not right to do so. Sometimes you've got to line up a shot and get in flanking position.Sometimes you've got to wait. Sometimes you've got to swing late. Sometimes you've got to say, "Hey, I'm gonna smack you, softly."

recipe.name: Royal Diplomacy

entries: In the courts and noble houses of the world, sometimes diplomacy can use a little bit of social lubrication to get the proceedings started. This deceivingly sweet drink can sneak up on you just like the best courtesan

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce blended whiskey (such as Crown Royal)

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except orange wheel in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine.
2. Strain into a cocktail glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish with orange wheel.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: It's often asked what the difference between standard diplomacy and royal diplomacy is. If you're being calm and gracious in order to get everyone to agree, that's regular diplomacy. If you're being calm and gracious in order to not get beheaded, that's royal diplomacy.

recipe.name: Stealth Checks

entries: These innocuous shots may look like little more than clear, firm gin and tonics, and in fact they are just that. However, should they fall victim to the directed attention of a UV spot check, they'll light up as bright as a rogue who should never have split the party. The secret? Quinine in the tonic water reacts to ultraviolet light in spectacular fluorescence.

instructions: 1. In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring tonic water to a boil.
2. Place gelatin and sugar in a medium heatproof bowl, then add boiled tonic water.
3. Stir until completely dissolved, then set aside 10 minutes or until cooled to room temperature.
4. Stir in gin, lime juice, and rose water.
5. Divide the mixture equally into shot glasses (approximately ten US glasses).
6. Refrigerate until set firm, at least 2 hours.7. Serve, using any sort of black light to create the glow effect. This will work best in an otherwise dark room.

recipe.name: Turn Undead

entries: When the dead rise up and threaten the living, it is the holy clerics that can stem the tide and cast back the horde. With this drink, you will find that the bitter and sour that you might expect is turned into something much more pleasing.

instructions: 1. Pour all ingredients over ice in an old-fashioned glass.
2. Stir and serve.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: There has been some confusion over the ability of Turn Undead. Often an embarrassed cleric or paladin will have to calmly explain that it is not, in fact, a way to join the ranks of the unliving. If one wishes to turn undead, it's probably wise to seek out a necromancer instead.

recipe.name: Twin Strikes

entries: When you want to ensure that your foes will not escape unscathed, it's best to make sure your shot counts by coming at them from multiple angles. This simple and effective shot comes at you with a sweetness from the liqueur and then follows up with the tartness of the lime.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine.
2. Strain into two shot glasses.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Many rangers practice to become ambidextrous so that they can dual wield with much more efficiency. This becomes an even more practical skill when attempting to get multiple drinks from the bar...to share with the party, of course.

recipe.name: Acid Arrow

entries: There's something magical about this fruity and sweet blend of ingredients. Once mixed together, the herbal top helps to counter the spell of overwhelming sugar in the juice.

instructions: 1. Combine coconut rum and pineapple juice in a shaker with ice and shake well.
2. Strain into a shot glass.
3. Float J√§germeister on top by pouring it slowly over the back of a spoon into the glass to form a layer.
4. If you want to "upcast" this shot into a cocktail, make the ingredients 1 ounce each, add to an ice-filled shaker to combine and chill, and strain into an ice-filled tumbler.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: This shot to the head is certain to do some acidic damage. Just make sure your aim is correct when you let this one loose, or you could be dealing with some splash damage.

recipe.name: Coors Light Wounds

entries: Even after a long rest and a good night's sleep, sometimes there are ailments that linger on. Should you find yourself in greatest need, you can always petition the local cleric to lift your spirits and repair your aches and complaints through divine magic. Or, barring access to divine casters, you can try this smoky, spiced delight.

ingredients: Taj√≠n or other chili spice blend

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounces Coors Light or other beer

instructions: 1. Mix salt and chili spices to cover the bottom of a small dish. Dip the rims of two rocks glasses in honey, then dip in the salt mixture to coat. Fill both glasses with ice.
2. In a pitcher, combine tomato juice and lime juice, beer, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce. Stir to mix.
3. Pour into prepared glasses.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: This concoction is rumored to ease your passage from even the most harrowing hangover. If you don't have any Coors Light on hand, congratulations! Give yourself 250 XP for not being burdened with cheap American lager. Now just substitute a tasty amber Mexican beer like a Dos Equis Ambar or a Modelo Negra.

recipe.name: Elemental Plane of Fire

entries: On the Plane of Fire, there is no escape from the intense heat and the flames that threaten to consume everything. While not quite as inescapable as its namesake, the Elemental Plane of Fire will give you a spicy kick while still delivering a tangy, tasty treat.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} small seedless watermelon (about 5 pounds), peeled and cubed
{=amount1/v} tablespoon Taj√≠n or other spice blend

instructions: 1. Combine watermelon and sparkling water in a blender and blend until smooth, approximately 30–45 seconds.
2. Strain pulp through a sieve into a punch bowl.
3. Chop jalape√±os into coins and shake loose excess seeds.
4. Add lime juice, tequila, sugar, and jalape√±o slices to bowl and stir.
5. Chill until ready to serve.
6. Combine spice blend with salt in a small bowl. Run a lime wedge around the rim of several punch glasses and dip the rims into the spice and salt blend.
7. Pour beverage into prepared glasses with ice and serve.

recipe.name: Black Mana

entries: Seeking something a little sinister? Try out a Black Mana, the coalesced essence of death, decay, and subversion. Sure, that might not sound like an appetizing start to a cocktail, but good news abounds, because the denizens of eternal night like coffee drinks as much as we do, if not more. This sweet midnight draft will keep you going through hours of grave-bound machinations.

instructions: 1. Combine vodka, coffee liqueur, and cr√®me de cacao in a shaker with ice and shake to combine.
2. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Add chilled espresso and powdered activated charcoal and stir.

recipe.name: Green Mana

entries: The magical influences of wild places, the spiritual energy that lives in leaf, soil, and creature alike...green mana is nature made manifest. To appreciate the best it has to offer, try this enchanting blend of melon, mint, and lime, which will set your mind to all things natural and your soul to birdsong.

instructions: 1. Add 10 mint leaves and melon liqueur to a shaker and muddle.
2. Combine with lime juice, rum, and ice and shake to chill.
3. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
4. Add club soda and stir.
5. Garnish with remaining mint leaves.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The original version of this cocktail also contained 2 tablespoons of assorted spider parts and most of an ape. We've modified the beverage into a vegetarian blend out of respect for nature (and because the apes kept eating the good spider parts).

recipe.name: Faerie Fire

entries: Sparks and glitter in the darkness of the swamp portend mischievous ghosts, protective nature spirits, or secretive druids conducting ancient rituals. In this orange-essence blue beverage, they merely portend the presence of sparkling LED ice cubes.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except LED ice cubes and orange wheel in a shaker with ice and shake well.
2. Pour into a hurricane glass with LED ice cubes inside.
3. Garnish with orange wheel on top.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: There are a variety of ways to acquire glowing, blinking ice cubes. You can seek the services of friendly enchanters, trap the spirit of a lantern ghost on a midwinter's night, or—by far the most common—get them online, since they generally run a dozen for about $15.

recipe.name: Hpnotiq Pattern

entries: A clever mage knows that you don't have to kill your opponent when you can much more easily dazzle them with a swirling, colorful display. When these two liquids mix, you get a lustrous, swirling, color-changing concoction that has a fruity and unique flavor.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce Hpnotiq or other lustrous swirling liqueur

instructions: 1. Place ice in a cocktail glass.
2. Pour Hpnotiq first and then cognac over ice.
3. Stir to combine.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: The interesting thing about a spell that mesmerizes all who look at it is that nobody can really remember what the pattern in question actually looks like. There have been varying loose accounts with some saying it looked like a human infant that was dancing and others saying the pattern took the form of a clothed feline playing some manner of keyed instrument.

recipe.name: Blue Mana

entries: The fury of the seas, the rush of the breeze, and the quiet contemplation of the scholar all embody the complexity of blue mana. So, too, can this combination of sweet, sour, and bitter be swirled together into a concoction that is bound to be an inspiration.

instructions: 1. Rub lime wedge around the rim of a rocks glass. Sprinkle sugar onto a small plate, then dip the moistened rim into the sugar to coat lightly.
2. Combine all remaining ingredients except luster dust in a shaker with ice and shake to combine.
3. Strain into sugared glass. Sprinkle luster dust over finished cocktail and serve.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Mages who favor the use of blue mana are famous (or perhaps infamous) for their reliance upon countermagic. It is said that you can always tell whentwo great blue wizards are dueling by the lack of anything happening.

recipe.name: Red Mana

entries: When you consider a cocktail on the basis of destructive fury, flame, and stone, and aggressive creatures of mountain and warren, whiskey immediately comes to mind. A fiery blend that soothes as it burns, the Red Mana is a challenging drink that you should tap into. For one damage.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Thai chili or jalape√±o coin for garnish

instructions: 1. Combine both whiskeys and grenadine in a shaker with ice and shake to chill.
2. Strain into a cocktail glass filled with ice.
3. Add club soda and stir to combine.
4. Garnish with your chosen pepper.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Many times a goblin raiding party has made its way into the lands of man and caused swaths of destruction. Nobody is sure what spurs the goblins to do this, but the most credible idea postulated so far is that it's the result of drunken dares taken entirely too far.

The druids of the wild lands know that sometimes food is scarce. When needed, they can magically contain an entire meal's worth of nutrition within a single berry. With a little of your own magical knowhow, you, too, can create something that packs far more than it seems into one drink. With all the flavor of the sweet berries and a little tartness for balance, you've packed a whole lot of flavor into one glass.

entries.entry: {=amount1/v} cup frozen mixed berries (blackberries, hulled strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, and pitted cherries will all work here)

instructions.name: For the Goodberry Syrup
entries: Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat and bring mixture to a simmer.
Cook 4–5 minutes until berries have softened and released their juices and sugar has dissolved.
Remove syrup from heat and allow to cool completely, approximately 5–10 minutes.
Strain through a mesh sieve to remove berry pieces and set aside.

instructions.name: For the Cocktail:
entries: Put sugar in a small bowl. Moisten the rims of four cocktail glasses with water, then dip the rims into the sugar.
Combine Goodberry Syrup, lime juice, and tequila with ice in a shaker and shake until chilled.
Strain into cocktail glasses filled with ice.
Garnish each glass with skewered berries and lime wheels.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Philosophers have long wondered what it means to be good. If a berry can be said to be good, then should we not also be? Does the existence of a Goodberry necessitate the hidden threat of the Evilberry? Druids have much to ponder while talking to trees and turning into badgers.

recipe.name: White Mana

entries: White mana is the essence of purity, civilization, and teamwork (which is of course why this recipe makes two servings). Naturally, these things, when distilled and combined into a beverage, will taste like upscale party-friendly chocolate milk. Offer this sweet celebratory drink to the angel in your life.

instructions: 1. In a shallow dish, add enough sugar to coat the bottom. Dip the rims of two martini glasses in water, then dip in the sugar to coat.
2. Combine vodka and condensed milk in a shaker with ice and shake vigorously to combine.
3. Strain into sugared glasses.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: For additional White Mana perfection, allow us to offer a serving suggestion. This drink pairs well with at least fifteen little cocktail weenies.

recipe.name: Magic Mistletoe

entries: Even in a world of magic and monsters, it's still nice to be able to celebrate a holiday with those you love, and appreciate the flavors and smells of winter. With a little mixology magic, you can create a drink that will give the gift of smiles and look good doing it.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)

instructions: 1. Muddle 7 cranberries and orange half-wheels in a Collins glass.
2. Add gin and simple syrup, and fill the glass with ice, including LED cube.
3. Fill with cranberry juice and club soda.
4. Stir with thyme sprig, and garnish with remaining cranberries.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Nobody can quite remember why it is that mistletoe became a traditional decoration in the winter months. Wizards have said that it may have beenpart of an ancient spell component ritual that would help attack the darkness in the long winter nights.

recipe.name: Psionic Blasts

entries: A ripping blast of raw mental energy, the psionic blast is the mind mage's most overwhelming and powerful attack. These shots maintain the crackling halo of a psionic at full force, while thoughtfully reducing the mental damage by several orders of magnitude.

ingredients: Pop Rocks or other popping candy
instructions: 1. Add vanilla frosting to a small bowl, then dip the rims of six shot glasses into frosting.
2. Pour candy into a small bowl, then drip frosting-rimmed shot glasses in candy to coat.
3. Combine vodka, blue cura√ßao, and lime juice with ice in a shaker and shake to chill.
4. Strain into shot glasses.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: If you find your intellect fortress assailed by these libations, consider switching to water for the duration of the evening. Your memories will both remain and thank you in the morning

recipe.name: Gelatinous Cubes

entries: The translucent dungeon abomination known as the gelatinous cube is famous for deceiving adventurers into ignoring it until it's too late. Then, of course, it dissolves them into a thin nutrient paste. These adorable cinnamon shots can also sneak up on you, so "consume mindlessly," in moderation.

instructions: 1. Place ¬º cup water into a small bowl and empty gelatin packets into water to bloom.
2. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar and remaining 1 ¬æ cups water.
3. Bring to a simmer and swirl pan until sugar is completely dissolved (do not stir, just swirl the pan).
4. Combine sugar water, bloomed gelatin, and Goldschl√§ger in a medium baking dish and stir to combine.
5. Add as much green food coloring as desired to create slime appearance.
6. Stir again to agitate gold flakes.
7. Chill for at least 2 hours or until fully set.
8. Slice and serve in ten cubes.

recipe.name: Giant Bee

entries: Sometimes the deadliest monsters make the most delightful drinks. The Giant Bee is a charmingly packaged delivery mechanism for the complexities of good gin and the subtle toothsome sweetness of honey, but beware; it packs a citrusy sting. It may be a random encounter the first time, but after a few sips, you'll want this beverage as a familiar.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} Unze Honigsirup (siehe Rezept in Tavern Basics)

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake vigorouslyto combine.
2. Strain into a rocks glass.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: If the Giant Bee proves insufficient as a challenge to your party, consider the following template to give it more body, power, bite, and hit points as needed.

noteCook: The Dire Bee: Substitute hot honey syrup for honey syrup.

recipe.name: Goblin Grenades

entries: These evil green little monsters are anything but subtle. A zestysweet combination of jalape√±o and strawberry, each shot has a spicy zing to it that you might find delightful until it blows up like the ramshackle concoction it is. For maximum chaos, this beverage is served directly in a jalape√±o, rimmed with extra spice for extra pain. And just like the genuine goblinoid article, these little sneaks travel in numbers.

entries.entry: {=amount1/v} tablespoons Taj√≠n or other spice blend

instructions: 1. For the Shot Glasses: Cut the tops off the jalape√±os and use a spoon or knife to remove seeds and whites from inside.
2. Add spice blend to cover the bottom of a small bowl.
3. Dip each jalape√±o in lime juice, then dip in spice blend to rim the jalape√±o.
4. Set aside to dry.
5. For the Cocktail: Zest and juice the lime.
6. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine lime juice, zest, strawberries, sugar, water, and jalape√±o and cook for 5 minutes.
7. Transfer to a blender and pulse once.
8. Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve.
9. Add vodka to strained mixture and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
10. Pour mixture into each jalape√±o immediately before serving.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Consider placing each jalape√±o inside a convenient shot glass that you could have just used in the first place. A great way to serve them is to fill a bowl with little chocolate candies and stand each loaded jalape√±o shooter upright among them. Just keep a sharp eye out, as any halfway competent goblin will steal your candies, your bowl, and probably blow up your dog on the way out.

recipe.name: Illithid Substance

entries: Mind flayers are utterly and terrifyingly inhuman, and so are their bars. There's loose brain matter slopping out of highball glasses everywhere; the lighting is dim to the point of near darkness, only occasionally punctuated by mind-addling strobe flashes from nowhere; and the jukebox selection is all Counting Crows B-sides. Of course there are good reasons to visit too, among them this apple and whiskey concoction, which is sour, sweet, and swirling with psychic residue.

ingredients.entry: {=amount1/v} ounce simple syrup (see recipe in Tavern Basics)

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients except swizzle stick in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine.
2. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with swizzle stick or other stirrer.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Like virtually every other object or substance dreamed up or concocted by a mind flayer, this beverage was not meant to last in our reality for long. The luster within it will rapidly settle to the bottom in a puddle of silty dust without regular agitation.

recipe.name: 1d3 Wandering Minstrels

entries: If you've gone wandering through the countryside, then you know how inevitable it is that you will eventually run into one to three wandering minstrels when you least expect it. So, too, can this drink blindside you when three different whiskeys all blend together in one place. Enjoy, as much as anyone can enjoy wandering minstrels.

instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously to combine and chill.
2. Strain into a shot glass.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: Of course I hear you say, "But it's {@dice 1d3} Wandering Minstrels! Why does it always have 3?!" Far be it from us to tell you how to enjoy your whiskey. If you want, roll a {@dice 1d3|d3} and then reduce the different alcohols accordingly.

recipe.name: Kobold Fashioned

entries: The yapping, snapping, and trap-making of the common kobold can be infuriating to those who are forced to live near them, especially the dragons they tend to live in service of. Those dragons need a libation to take their mind off the latest round of some minor clan chieftain inventing the "skunk on a pole" or some similar act of tomfoolery. Such dragons can at least count on kobold bar chiefs, who may only know how to make one cocktail, but it's a trusted classic.

instructions: 1. Place sugar cube in an old-fashioned glass and douse with 2 dashes of bitters.
2. Add water and muddle until dissolved.
3. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.
4. Garnish with lime twist and maraschino cherry speared together on a toothpick.

recipe.name: Mermaid Lagoon

entries: In clear blue pools, you can find a mermaid if you're very lucky, or perhaps very unlucky depending on the stories you believe. Anyone who comes across this refreshing, tropical lagoon of flavor will definitely want to dive right in, and risks be damned.

instructions: 1. Fill a punch bowl halfway with ice.
2. Pour in blue cura√ßao and melon liqueur.
3. Top with prosecco, pineapple juice, rum, and seltzer.
4. Mix, and add half the pineapple chunks and 10 halved cherries.
5. Garnish punch cups with remaining pineapple and cherries, skewered.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: This drink is so good that it has been known to shipwreck sailors that have heard its song coming from the jagged rocks. It has yet to be revealed how a bowl of punch could sing and who put it out on some jagged rocks in the first place. Maybe they wanted to get their drink...on the rocks.

recipe.name: Troll Slobber

entries: Out in the swamps and forests of the untamed wilderness, you can tell when you come across a troll's home from the distinctive goo left behind. Don't worry, though: This sweet and bubbly version trades in the regenerative slime for a tangy, creamy lime flavor.

instructions: 1. Scoop sherbet into a tall cocktail glass (such as a Collins glass).
2. Add rum and soda.
3. Stir with a cocktail spoon to create a cloudy bottom without overstirring in order to maintain bubbles. The top should foam up. Carefully place cherries on top of the foam.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
entries: There is a rumor that the slobber of a troll can impart some of their astounding regenerative abilities to anyone brave enough to imbibe it. That rumor was started by Trandish the Bard in an attempt to trick his friend into drinking troll spit and was, by all accounts, hilarious.

recipe.name: Wight Russian

entries: Whiskey supplants vodka in this death-defying variation on the classic White Russian, in no small part because whiskey is the core spirit choice of intelligent undead everywhere (this isn't a joke; it's just a well-known fact—ask any mummy). This creamy concoction will send a paralytic chill down your spine.

instructions: 1. Combine coffee, coffee liqueur, and whiskey in an ice-filled shaker and shake to combine.
2. Strain into a chilled old-fashioned glass.
3. Fill with heavy cream and bitters.
4. Twist orange peel over glass to express the orange oils.

recipe.name: Rust Monster

entries: The bane of fighters everywhere, the rust monster can quickly turn even the sturdiest armor and shields to so much oxidized dust and ruin. Canny adventurers are quick to avoid these chitinous terrors, but the drink that bears their name is hard to avoid. Complexities abound in this herbal, unusual variation on the traditional rusty nail.

instructions: Mix mezcal and Drambuie in a tumbler glass over a large ice cube.

noteCook.name: D√úNGEONMEISTER TIP
